intro: Berkheya ingrata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Berkheya ingrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
